title: Hi, I’m bi.
body:
So uh, yeah.

Happy reading!

Peter’s quiet today.

Tony clocks it the moment the kid walks in the lab.

Usually, the kid is bouncing off the walls with excitement, ready to tackle whatever Tony has to throw at him and with a story from his day to boot.

But today… Today Peter wasn’t… Peter.

Tony decides to let the kid settle in and do his homework by himself for a while before he asks any questions.

An hour goes by before Peter makes any noise. And it’s just a small huff.

Tony looks up to see Peter chewing on the edges of his sleeves. A habit he developed a few months ago when he gets between nervous and upset.

Tony bites the inside of his cheek and takes a deep breath.

“FRIDAY, go ahead and order Chinese for tonight, our usual.”

“Of course.”

Peter doesn’t even stir from his staring contest with the wall when the two voices speak.

Tony gets up from his spot and moves to sit next to Peter at his desk.

Peter still doesn’t bat an eye.

It’s only when Tony lays a hand on the kid’s shoulder when Peter startles, gasping.

“Hey, it’s alright. Just me.”

Peter looks at Tony for a moment before nodding and looking back at the wall.

“Wanna tell me what’s got you so…?” Tony makes an odd gesture towards Peter with his hands.

Peter shrugs, “I don’t know,”

Tony gently pushes him with his shoulder, “Please? A hundred bucks for your thoughts?”

The boy giggles, “It’s ‘a penny for your thoughts’.”

“Yeah well I’m a billionaire so I’ll pay whatever I damn well please for your thoughts.”

Peter laughs again, then turns towards his father figure.

“Can I ask you something?”

“Anything.” Tony says, nodding.

Peter bites his lip and hesitates, his mouth opening and closing a few times before he asks, “Are you bi?”

The question stuns Tony at first. Where the hell did-

Oh.

“What?”

Peter’s eyes aren’t meeting Tony’s and he’s wringing his hands.

“Bi, like, bisexual. Like, you’re sexually attracted to-“

“I know what it means Peter!” Tony holds up his hands to stop Peter from giving him a talk he doesn’t need.

“Sorry,” Peter shrinks a little, “It’s just that, sometimes you do or say things, and I thought, maybe,”

“Kid, stop.”

Peter’s mouth slams shut. Tony drums on the desk for a second before answering, “You’re right. I am.”

Peter’s head snaps up and for the first time that day his eyes meet Tony’s.

“Wait, really?”

“Yes, really. Why are you asking me this?” Although, Tony has a pretty good idea as to why Peter’s asking.

“Well, I.. I, um…” Peter was biting his lip again and scratching his neck.

Tony raised a brow, but didn’t speak. He was going to let Peter do this on his own terms.

After a few long moments, he let out a defeated sigh, deflating.

“I’m bi, too.”

“Well don’t seem so upset about it.”

“What?”

He claps the boy’s shoulder, “Pete, it’s who you are. No shame in that. You love who you love. Boy, girl, non-binary, whoever. I don’t care how you identify or what your sexuality is as long as its not harming you or anyone else. I love you for you. Got it?”

And yeah, Peter gets it, but this is the first time Tony has ever explicitly said the words “I love you” to him and he’s trying not to make a big deal out of it.

So he nods his head, albeit a little too rough, and replies, “Yeah. Got it.” Sniffling, he wipes his nose quickly and a tear that had escaped.

In an attempt to get rid of the emotions built up in his throat, Tony adds, “Plus, statistically that adds like, what, another fifty perfect chance you’ll find a suitable partner?”

Peter giggles again, “I don’t think that’s how the math works.”

Tony chuckled, “Fine, whatever. But you know, I’ve had a suspicion that you were into guys for a while. You practically drool whenever you’re around Thor.”

Peter’s lips thinned into a line and his face turned a deep red.

“Do not.”

“Actually, you do. Even Cap, the man out of time himself where homosexuality was illegal and ignored, asked me if you had some sort of crush on him. May and I even made a bet on how long it would take you to come out.”

Peter squawked, mouth dropping to the floor, “What!”

Tony shrugged, “I told Cap to ask you. Obviously that didn’t happen. And now I owe May ten bucks. ”

“Ugh, wonderful. Now I’ve completely embarrassed myself. And my parents are gambling on my emotional turmoil.”

“If it’s any consolation, you’ll embarrass yourself a whole lot more in your lifetime.”

“Mister Stark!”

“There there, spider baby,” Tony pat his kid’s brown curls, “How about we go officially tell Aunt Hottie. And the team. I may owe her ten bucks but now half the team owes me like fifty.”

Peter groaned, slamming his head down on the table so hard that Tony later made Bruce check his head for injuries.

***

“Do not.”

“Actually, you do. Even Cap, the man out of time himself where homosexuality was illegal and ignored, asked me if you had some sort of crush on him. May and I even made a bet on how long it would take you to come out.”

Peter squawked, mouth dropping to the floor, “What!”

Tony shrugged, “I told Cap to ask you. Obviously that didn’t happen. And now I owe May ten bucks. ”

“Ugh, wonderful. Now I’ve completely embarrassed myself. And my parents are gambling on my emotional turmoil.”

“If it’s any consolation, you’ll embarrass yourself a whole lot more in your lifetime.”

“Mister Stark!”

“There there, spider baby,” Tony pat his kid’s brown curls, “How about we go officially tell Aunt Hottie. And the team. I may owe her ten bucks but now half the team owes me like fifty.”

blog.name: su--per--star
blog.title: Proof That Tony Stark Has A Heart
blog.description: Worshiping the ground upon which Tony Stark walks. Natasha Romanoff is a God. Multi-fandom.

summary: So because this is overwhelming me with emotions, I'm back on this pro Pepper and Rhodes thing, and what better way to start...
body:
So because this is overwhelming me with emotions, I’m back on this pro Pepper and Rhodes thing, and what better way to start than with this gif? 

Now, as we all know, this bit is near the end of Iron Man 3 when Tony is getting the shrapnel removed from his chest, and just…can’t you see the love and support in both Pepper and Rhodes facial expressions? The way Rhodes puts a thumbs up, and the way Pepper is struggling to hold back tears of joy? Seriously people, this shit is beautiful, and to say Pepper and Rhodes have abused and neglected him is delusional.

Like, did we watch the same movies? Pepper and Rhodes are literally ride or die for Tony. Yes, Tony is mentally ill and needs professional counseling, but to say Pepper and Rhodes getting fed up with his ever chaotic lifestyle is wrong is, well…wrong. Because it’s only human that they become overwhelmed with his antics, especially when they become a detriment to not just them but Tony as well.

Tony and Pepper’s temporary break up? That’s justified on Pepper’s part because she probably felt stressed never knowing whether or not Tony would die being Iron Man. Rhodes literal ass beating of Tony in Iron Man 2, as well as his constant beratings of Tony in future movies? Also completely justified. Because for as much as he’s been done wrong, Tony isn’t an angel (the only difference is that he owns up to that), and you can’t tell me that the two people closet to him aren’t allowed to be frustrated with him.

Besides, the thing about Pepper and Rhodes is that no matter what, they always come back to Tony. Through thick and thin, and through hell and high water, they never turn their back on him, even when they need some time apart.

So to say Pepper and Rhodes don’t care enough about Tony is factually untrure, because when everyone left Tony in the dust, they were always there, and they’ll continue to be there, and it goes without saying that Tony wouldn’t be able to function even halfway as a human being if it weren’t for them being by his side. Thanks for coming to my Ted Talk.

Besides, the thing about Pepper and Rhodes is that no matter what, they always come back to Tony. Through thick and thin, and through hell and high water, they never turn their back on him, even when they need some time apart.

So to say Pepper and Rhodes don’t care enough about Tony is factually untrure, because when everyone left Tony in the dust, they were always there, and they’ll continue to be there, and it goes without saying that Tony wouldn’t be able to function even halfway as a human being if it weren’t for them being by his side. Thanks for coming to my Ted Talk.

summary: Okay folks. I rewatched Ant-Man and the Wasp and I realized something...
body:
Okay folks. I rewatched Ant-Man and the Wasp and I realized something…

In the end credit scene, Janet tells Scott to watch out for Time-Portals or something before he goes back into the Quantum Realm. And she told him that if he got sucked into one, they wouldn’t be able to save him.

In the Endgame trailer, the footage of Scott that Natasha and Steve are looking at has a very very very early year on the time stamp.

And, the behind the scenes photos we’ve seen of the movie shows Steve in his uniform from the first movie.

I think what happened was, Scott got sucked into one of the time loops/portals. That’s the only explanation I can think of.

title: Last Man Left Standing #Part 1
body:
Mob/Mafia AU 

FatherFigure!Tony Stark x Peter Parker, Peter Parker x Reader (slow burn but worth it)

Quick Note: Written as part of @tom-hollandaze ‘s Writing Challenge! I have so much more lined up for this story but it’s a long piece so I decided to break it up into parts. Nonetheless, thank you so much for allowing me to take part in this challenge!!! Also apologies that it’s a day late!! :( 

Summary: Sometimes all it takes is one boy to change everyone’s lives, and his name’s Peter Parker. This is his story. 

Warnings: bad language, angst, violence, shooting

Word Count: 2070 words

Facing the dull window of his office, Anthony swirled the whiskey in his glass as he allowed himself to dissolve in deep thought yet again. The window was covered in blinds which allowed ever so little light to peak through the short gaps. Just like in this moment, everything in the man’s life has always been so black and white and grey.

A loud knock on the door woke him from his thoughts, as the sound echoed throughout the poorly-lit office.

Anthony turned in his chair, facing his desk yet again. With his peace of mind now gone, he yanked down the glass onto the table’s surface causing some of the liquid to escape and spill over the rim of the glass. He wasn’t going to get a break today or ever really. The man wanted to get away from his infamous occupation, but that was where life placed him and that was where he would remain.

His father was once a powerful mobster himself, as of now he laid six feet underground with no power whatsoever. The man hated his father with a passion for his terror-filled childhood. Everyone feared that awful man, his own son probably the most. Anthony had no choice but to carry on his father’s illegal business to fulfill his legacy. He was never harsh or a man full of hatred unlike his father, but when he heard of the murder of his parents, in particularly of his mother, that was the final straw. He swore he’d find the bastard and take his revenge.

“Come on in!” he shouted at the door, interrupting the peaceful silence of his office.

The door slowly proceeded to open with an awful creak filling the room from the movement, only to reveal a man stepping into the office from behind it. He wasn’t nervous. No, these men weren’t the nervous type.

He wore a simple grey fedora hat along with a boring grey suit. At least the white shirt he wore along with a black tie added some colour to his dull attire.

Motioning to the seat in front of him for the man to sit down, Anthony sat back in his seat. Filling the once quiet office with his harsh tone of voice, a fire lit in his eyes. “Well, are you gonna talk today or just waste my time?”

Removing the fedora from his head, the other man finally sat down. It was clear that the infamous Anthony Stark was beginning to grow impatient waiting for him to spit out whatever it was he had to spit out.

“With all respect sir, Banner had noticed someone wandering ‘round your warehouse in the south of the city.”

The mobster behind the desk was quick to slam his hand down forcefully, welcoming the silence to re-fill his office once again. Of course, he wouldn’t be happy to know that there was someone snooping around his warehouse, especially since that one held several amounts of powerful weaponry. Allowing a moment to pass for some careful thinking, it was a no-brainer of what he should do.

Standing up from his seat, he was quick to grab his long coat from the hanger by the door, wrapping it over his own suited attire. Placing his own hat on his head, he paced past the man to the door only to stop briefly before leaving his office.

“You better be right… or you know the consequences” he pointed to him in a threatening manner, leaving the man with a cold chill behind.

Anthony hated being disturbed, but he certainly hated thieving bastards more than anything else. Grabbing the keys to his vehicle, he made his way out towards the car.

The street outside seemed empty enough, probably due to the dull clouds and the rainfall they carried with them. Well, it seemed almost empty apart from the one lady that walked along the path, pushing a buggy.

The mobster had to admit that it was strange to see a young lady out on a walk with her baby in the rain. Instead of hopping into his car and hurrying down to his warehouse, he decided to run up to the lady. A minute or two wouldn’t hurt.

“Ma'am it’s a bad time to be walking a baby now is it not?”

The lady stopped in her tracks and looked up at the man in front of her. She recognised his face, anyone in this part of the city would’ve. She, like many others heard several infamous stories about him but she had a heart of gold and decided not to judge unless she saw it herself.

Sending the man, a gentle smile she responded, “I’m sure you have more important things to worry about than a lady in the rain Mr. Stark.”

He returned the smile as he walked on beside her. It was at very rare occasions that he would smile a genuine smile and yet here it danced along his lips. “A little bit of rain? Perhaps not, yet it’s absolutely pouring … uh” he breathed “I don’t believe I quite caught your name”.

Continuing her way, she let a small chuckle to escape “That’s perhaps because I never told you”.

Allowing another grin to pass, the man decided to halt in his tracks. He couldn’t deny that the sweet stranger had caught his attention, but he really had to go to check on the warehouse.

To his surprise the beautiful lady decided to stop also, only to turn and face him. “May” she smiled, and when she did, he swore that her smile could make all the clouds go away along with any gloomy greys that filled his dark life.

“Let me at least get you an umbrella. I don’t want your baby to get sick” he told her as he took a quick peak under the hood of the pram. The baby inside it laid fast asleep while holding tightly onto the corner of the blanket that covered him. He looked quite snug inside despite the cool air from the outside. It was clear that May had taken the cold into consideration before the walk and made sure that the baby was prepared for the harsh weather.

Looking in at the little boy, so soft and innocent, Anthony couldn’t lie – the sight warmed his cold heart.

“Oh no no, he’s not-” she smiled following his line of sight “-this little darling is my neph-”

Just before the beautiful lady had the chance to finish her sentence, the mobster’s ears rang from the sound of a gunshot. Before he had the chance to react and pull the woman (who managed to capture his heart within seconds) behind him, he noticed the little puddle of red emerging over her chest.

Looking down at the patch that now stained her dress, she pressed her hand to it, only to bring it up to her line of sight and inspect the foreign warm liquid on her fingers. Unable to muster any words, she looked directly into Anthony’s eyes, the simple eye contact communicating a thousand words.

The sound of two more gunshots filled the tense atmosphere, however the woman in front of him was now his primary concern.

He didn’t need her to say anything, he was quick to step up and catch her before she grew weak and her legs finally gave in underneath her. Falling to the ground with the gracious woman now dying in his arms, he reached one hand into the inside of his jacket to pull out his gun. Looking around he tried to figure out where the damned coward who shot this angel hid, but to no effect. Men knew better than to miss when aiming at the Anthony Stark, so it wouldn’t have been a surprise to him if whoever did it decided to scramble away immediately.

Reassuring himself that there wasn’t a soul present, he turned his attention back to May. She laid motionlessly, her pale face staring up at him stuck in its lifeless expression. Allowing a low curse to escape, he followed the trail of her arm up to where her hand loosely remained against the buggy.

It was at that moment that he realised what had happened. A young woman’s life had been taken from her, leaving her baby boy behind all alone.

The little child that had been asleep merely seconds ago, had woken with the sound of the gunshot, his cries now clashing with the sound of the heavy rain.

The gangster didn’t know what to do. He was left on an empty street with a crying baby and without a doubt, a sense of guilt that an innocent woman had taken the bullet that was aimed for him.

Perhaps it was the guilt inside of him, or the fact that he knew what it was like to lose a mother due to such sickening actions, but when he looked at that baby, he knew somewhere deep down inside that he couldn’t leave him on his own. He sensed that he now had some responsibility to look after him.

Gently resting the woman down on the pavement nearby, the man got up and leaned in to pick up the boy from the pram. As he held him, the child slowly began to ease off on his cries, opening his eyes to look up at the man that was carrying him.

Anthony couldn’t lie it felt strange, but the way the child’s eyes glistened, he knew he was doing the right thing.

Carrying the boy back into the building he previously left from, he was quick to yell at his men from the entrance door.

“LISTEN UP! THERE’S A LADY LYING DEAD ACROSS THE STREET, I WANT EVERY SINGLE ONE OF YOU TO GO FIND OUT WHAT YOU POSSIBLY CAN ABOUT HER AND WHOEVER F*CKING DARED TO SHOOT HER. SEARCH THE AREA, FIND THEM AND BRING THEM TO ME!”

He paused to look down briefly at the little boy in his arms, seeing that the shouting wasn’t affecting him, he decided to continue to roar his commands. “RHODES, HOGAN, I WANT HER TO GET A PROPER BURIAL. I’M HEADING DOWN TO THE WAREHOUSE, I WANT THIS SORTED BEFORE I GET BACK!”

Despite the confused looks and shouts he received from the men inside, Stark left them all behind without any other word. Hopping into the car with the child still in his arms, he went on in his awkward drive to the south of the city.

Although the ride was rather challenging, he had eventually reached his other premises wherein he held the weaponry.

The main man in charge of safe-guarding the place, Banner, was quick to jog up to him upon his arrival.

“Tony” he spoke up, ready to explain what had happened. Banner was one of the very few men who could call Anthony by his name.

The mobster however gave him a quick dismissing wave “Bruce, that can wait.”

It was at that moment that his friend noticed the little boy. Seeing that he was ready to ask questions, Stark was quick to speak again. “You have a little daughter, yeah?”

Bruce nodded. “Yeah, yeah. Y/N. She’s only a few months old.”

“This boy, he has no one that I know of right now, his mother was shot in my presence. I’m trying to find out who he is, for any family at all but until then I need your help to look after him.”

Bruce agreed to take on the responsibility to look after him for a short while. That was until weeks later it became apparent of who the child was. The boy was little Peter Parker, and the woman that was shot on the spot wasn’t in fact his mother… it was his aunt.

Anthony and his men tried to trace down any other family of his, but the woman was the last traceable guardian left… he truly had no one at all. With little to no options left in the fate of the child, the mobster took on the responsibility to take care of him and raise the boy. He took him under his wing to give him a proper shot at life rather than to leave him at an orphanage.

That decision on the man’s behalf was certainly one Peter grew eternally thankful for as years passed by.

He paused to look down briefly at the little boy in his arms, seeing that the shouting wasn’t affecting him, he decided to continue to roar his commands. “RHODES, HOGAN, I WANT HER TO GET A PROPER BURIAL. I’M HEADING DOWN TO THE WAREHOUSE, I WANT THIS SORTED BEFORE I GET BACK!”

Despite the confused looks and shouts he received from the men inside, Stark left them all behind without any other word. Hopping into the car with the child still in his arms, he went on in his awkward drive to the south of the city.

Although the ride was rather challenging, he had eventually reached his other premises wherein he held the weaponry.

The main man in charge of safe-guarding the place, Banner, was quick to jog up to him upon his arrival.

“Tony” he spoke up, ready to explain what had happened. Banner was one of the very few men who could call Anthony by his name.

The mobster however gave him a quick dismissing wave “Bruce, that can wait.”

It was at that moment that his friend noticed the little boy. Seeing that he was ready to ask questions, Stark was quick to speak again. “You have a little daughter, yeah?”

Bruce nodded. “Yeah, yeah. Y/N. She’s only a few months old.”

“This boy, he has no one that I know of right now, his mother was shot in my presence. I’m trying to find out who he is, for any family at all but until then I need your help to look after him.”

Bruce agreed to take on the responsibility to look after him for a short while. That was until weeks later it became apparent of who the child was. The boy was little Peter Parker, and the woman that was shot on the spot wasn’t in fact his mother… it was his aunt.

Anthony and his men tried to trace down any other family of his, but the woman was the last traceable guardian left… he truly had no one at all. With little to no options left in the fate of the child, the mobster took on the responsibility to take care of him and raise the boy. He took him under his wing to give him a proper shot at life rather than to leave him at an orphanage.

That decision on the man’s behalf was certainly one Peter grew eternally thankful for as years passed by.

The window was covered in blinds which allowed ever so little light to peak through the short gaps. Just like in this moment, everything in the man’s life has always been so black and white and grey.

A loud knock on the door woke him from his thoughts, as the sound echoed throughout the poorly-lit office.

Anthony turned in his chair, facing his desk yet again. With his peace of mind now gone, he yanked down the glass onto the table’s surface causing some of the liquid to escape and spill over the rim of the glass. He wasn’t going to get a break today or ever really. The man wanted to get away from his infamous occupation, but that was where life placed him and that was where he would remain.

His father was once a powerful mobster himself, as of now he laid six feet underground with no power whatsoever. The man hated his father with a passion for his terror-filled childhood. Everyone feared that awful man, his own son probably the most. Anthony had no choice but to carry on his father’s illegal business to fulfill his legacy. He was never harsh or a man full of hatred unlike his father, but when he heard of the murder of his parents, in particularly of his mother, that was the final straw. He swore he’d find the bastard and take his revenge.

“Come on in!” he shouted at the door, interrupting the peaceful silence of his office.

The door slowly proceeded to open with an awful creak filling the room from the movement, only to reveal a man stepping into the office from behind it. He wasn’t nervous. No, these men weren’t the nervous type.

He wore a simple grey fedora hat along with a boring grey suit. At least the white shirt he wore along with a black tie added some colour to his dull attire.

Motioning to the seat in front of him for the man to sit down, Anthony sat back in his seat. Filling the once quiet office with his harsh tone of voice, a fire lit in his eyes. “Well, are you gonna talk today or just waste my time?”

[[MORE]]

Removing the fedora from his head, the other man finally sat down. It was clear that the infamous Anthony Stark was beginning to grow impatient waiting for him to spit out whatever it was he had to spit out.

“With all respect sir, Banner had noticed someone wandering ‘round your warehouse in the south of the city.”

The mobster behind the desk was quick to slam his hand down forcefully, welcoming the silence to re-fill his office once again. Of course, he wouldn’t be happy to know that there was someone snooping around his warehouse, especially since that one held several amounts of powerful weaponry. Allowing a moment to pass for some careful thinking, it was a no-brainer of what he should do.

Standing up from his seat, he was quick to grab his long coat from the hanger by the door, wrapping it over his own suited attire. Placing his own hat on his head, he paced past the man to the door only to stop briefly before leaving his office.

“You better be right… or you know the consequences” he pointed to him in a threatening manner, leaving the man with a cold chill behind.

Anthony hated being disturbed, but he certainly hated thieving bastards more than anything else. Grabbing the keys to his vehicle, he made his way out towards the car.

The street outside seemed empty enough, probably due to the dull clouds and the rainfall they carried with them. Well, it seemed almost empty apart from the one lady that walked along the path, pushing a buggy.

The mobster had to admit that it was strange to see a young lady out on a walk with her baby in the rain. Instead of hopping into his car and hurrying down to his warehouse, he decided to run up to the lady. A minute or two wouldn’t hurt.

“Ma'am it’s a bad time to be walking a baby now is it not?”

The lady stopped in her tracks and looked up at the man in front of her. She recognised his face, anyone in this part of the city would’ve. She, like many others heard several infamous stories about him but she had a heart of gold and decided not to judge unless she saw it herself.

Sending the man, a gentle smile she responded, “I’m sure you have more important things to worry about than a lady in the rain Mr. Stark.”

He returned the smile as he walked on beside her. It was at very rare occasions that he would smile a genuine smile and yet here it danced along his lips. “A little bit of rain? Perhaps not, yet it’s absolutely pouring … uh” he breathed “I don’t believe I quite caught your name”.

Continuing her way, she let a small chuckle to escape “That’s perhaps because I never told you”.

Allowing another grin to pass, the man decided to halt in his tracks. He couldn’t deny that the sweet stranger had caught his attention, but he really had to go to check on the warehouse.

To his surprise the beautiful lady decided to stop also, only to turn and face him. “May” she smiled, and when she did, he swore that her smile could make all the clouds go away along with any gloomy greys that filled his dark life.

“Let me at least get you an umbrella. I don’t want your baby to get sick” he told her as he took a quick peak under the hood of the pram. The baby inside it laid fast asleep while holding tightly onto the corner of the blanket that covered him. He looked quite snug inside despite the cool air from the outside. It was clear that May had taken the cold into consideration before the walk and made sure that the baby was prepared for the harsh weather.

Looking in at the little boy, so soft and innocent, Anthony couldn’t lie – the sight warmed his cold heart.

“Oh no no, he’s not-” she smiled following his line of sight “-this little darling is my neph-”

Just before the beautiful lady had the chance to finish her sentence, the mobster’s ears rang from the sound of a gunshot. Before he had the chance to react and pull the woman (who managed to capture his heart within seconds) behind him, he noticed the little puddle of red emerging over her chest.

Looking down at the patch that now stained her dress, she pressed her hand to it, only to bring it up to her line of sight and inspect the foreign warm liquid on her fingers. Unable to muster any words, she looked directly into Anthony’s eyes, the simple eye contact communicating a thousand words.

The sound of two more gunshots filled the tense atmosphere, however the woman in front of him was now his primary concern.

He didn’t need her to say anything, he was quick to step up and catch her before she grew weak and her legs finally gave in underneath her. Falling to the ground with the gracious woman now dying in his arms, he reached one hand into the inside of his jacket to pull out his gun. Looking around he tried to figure out where the damned coward who shot this angel hid, but to no effect. Men knew better than to miss when aiming at the Anthony Stark, so it wouldn’t have been a surprise to him if whoever did it decided to scramble away immediately.

Reassuring himself that there wasn’t a soul present, he turned his attention back to May. She laid motionlessly, her pale face staring up at him stuck in its lifeless expression. Allowing a low curse to escape, he followed the trail of her arm up to where her hand loosely remained against the buggy.

It was at that moment that he realised what had happened. A young woman’s life had been taken from her, leaving her baby boy behind all alone.

The little child that had been asleep merely seconds ago, had woken with the sound of the gunshot, his cries now clashing with the sound of the heavy rain.

The gangster didn’t know what to do. He was left on an empty street with a crying baby and without a doubt, a sense of guilt that an innocent woman had taken the bullet that was aimed for him.

Perhaps it was the guilt inside of him, or the fact that he knew what it was like to lose a mother due to such sickening actions, but when he looked at that baby, he knew somewhere deep down inside that he couldn’t leave him on his own. He sensed that he now had some responsibility to look after him.

Gently resting the woman down on the pavement nearby, the man got up and leaned in to pick up the boy from the pram. As he held him, the child slowly began to ease off on his cries, opening his eyes to look up at the man that was carrying him.

Anthony couldn’t lie it felt strange, but the way the child’s eyes glistened, he knew he was doing the right thing.

Carrying the boy back into the building he previously left from, he was quick to yell at his men from the entrance door.

“LISTEN UP! THERE’S A LADY LYING DEAD ACROSS THE STREET, I WANT EVERY SINGLE ONE OF YOU TO GO FIND OUT WHAT YOU POSSIBLY CAN ABOUT HER AND WHOEVER F*CKING DARED TO SHOOT HER. SEARCH THE AREA, FIND THEM AND BRING THEM TO ME!”

The mobster however gave him a quick dismissing wave “Bruce, that can wait.”

It was at that moment that his friend noticed the little boy. Seeing that he was ready to ask questions, Stark was quick to speak again. “You have a little daughter, yeah?”

Bruce nodded. “Yeah, yeah. Y/N. She’s only a few months old.”

“This boy, he has no one that I know of right now, his mother was shot in my presence. I’m trying to find out who he is, for any family at all but until then I need your help to look after him.”

Bruce agreed to take on the responsibility to look after him for a short while. That was until weeks later it became apparent of who the child was. The boy was little Peter Parker, and the woman that was shot on the spot wasn’t in fact his mother… it was his aunt.

Anthony and his men tried to trace down any other family of his, but the woman was the last traceable guardian left… he truly had no one at all. With little to no options left in the fate of the child, the mobster took on the responsibility to take care of him and raise the boy. He took him under his wing to give him a proper shot at life rather than to leave him at an orphanage.

That decision on the man’s behalf was certainly one Peter grew eternally thankful for as years passed by.

Tony: if...
body:
Stephen: you’re color blind right?

Tony: yeah, why?

Stephen: nothing just now I know what to get you for your birthday.

Tony: if you get me a Rubix cube, I’ll shoot you.
